thread.title: Manchester United's Anthony Martial targets leaders Chelsea after 6 wins in a row cut gap to 10 points
thread.title_full: Manchester United's Anthony Martial targets leaders Chelsea after 6 wins in a row cut gap to 10 points

author: David Anderson
title: Manchester United's Anthony Martial targets leaders Chelsea after 6 wins in a row cut gap to 10 points
text:
Sport Manchester United's Anthony Martial targets leaders Chelsea after 6 wins in a row cut gap to 10 points "The overall picture is very good. We’ve come back nicely into the mix" says striker before Sunday scrap with arch-rivals Liverpool Share Keeper David De Gea jumps for joy during United's most recent league win, at West Ham (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Anthony Martial claims Manchester United refuse to give up hope of overhauling Chelsea in the title race. 
United head into Sunday’s titanic tussle with second-placed arch-rivals Liverpool 10 points behind Antonio Conte’s leaders. 
But they are the form team, having won their last six Premier League games to climb to sixth in the table, and Martial says Chelsea — who had rattled off 13 victories in a row before losing at Spurs in their last league game — could stumble. 
“I think the overall picture is very good,” said the French forward, whose team have nine consecutive victories in all competitions. “That’s why we’ve done everything we can to win all our own games. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jose Mourinho reacts to Man United's win over West Ham Share this video Watch Next Read More Man United would be just TWO points off the top if it wasn't for the woodwork 
“We’ve come back nicely into the mix and we’re not far off third place now [Spurs occupy that spot with just three points more than United], and we’re five points off Liverpool, who we play at the weekend. 
“I think we’re definitely moving in the right direction. 
“I guess Chelsea have still got quite a healthy points advantage at the top, but you never know what can happen. We just have to keep on in the same way to try and finish as high as we possibly can at the end of the league season. 
“We’re on a good run at the moment, so we need to carry on in that vein of form so we can win as many games as possible.” Martial scored his first United goal as they beat Liverpool in this fixture last season (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Read More Zlatan Ibrahimovic claims he conquered the Premier League in three months 
Martial, 21, is returning to form himself after a difficult start to his second season at Old Trafford and has bagged four goals in his last seven games. 
He feels he is still only getting started at United, adding: “I’m still very young and I’ve got lots I want to achieve in my career. 
“What I would like to be able to do is win lots of silverware. It’s all about me working hard and doing everything I can to attain my objectives.” poll loading What's your prediction for this one? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
